description: This file implements the core functions of the Slap Loam Client Object, including creation, removal, object enrollment, and initialization. It defines how the object is created, configured, and interconnected with other system components, emphasizing object lifecycle management and internal structure setup.

classes.name: SLAP_LOAM_CLIENT_OBJECT
classes.description: The main object representing the Slap Loam Client, encapsulating properties, methods, and internal structures necessary for its operation.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE SlapLcoCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs a new instance of the Slap Loam Client Object, initializing its fundamental members and preparing it for use.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLcoRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the Slap Loam Client Object, cleaning up resources and internal states.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLcoEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolls auxiliary objects such as timers and interfaces the client depends on.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS SlapLcoInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the properties and internal state of the Slap Loam Client Object.
